message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,400,000. This is a great price considering the value it holds. Let me know your thoughts.

I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. I'm really interested in the product, but I have to make a smart financial decision. Can we meet in the middle at $1,300,000?

Bob, I understand your position, but I'm still not at a price point that works for me.  I'm willing to come down to $1,350,000. This is a fair price that reflects the value of the product. What do you say?

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1,350,000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but this time at $1,300,000 is not an option. I'm thinking more along the lines of $1,320,000. Can we meet at this price?

Bob, I'm getting the sense that we may not be able to reach a mutually agreeable price. I'm only willing to come down to $1,330,000. This is the absolute lowest I can go. If you're not comfortable with this, I'll have to explore other options.

I understand that you're trying to reach a mutually agreeable price, but $1,330,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you at $1,290,000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can make a deal at this price.
